    • Method Detail

      • checkPhoneNumber

        public void checkPhoneNumber(java.lang.String telephoneNumber)
                      throws IncorrectAreaCodeException,
                             IncorrectLengthException,
                             NonDigitFoundException
         This method checks if the phone number of the person meets the following criteria.
  1. The Phone number should be of 10 digits.
  2. The Phone number should be start with either "660" or "816". 
  3. The Phone number should consists of only numbers (Characters shouldn't be accepted).
        Parameters:
        telephoneNumber - The String value of telephone number.
        Throws:
        IncorrectAreaCodeException - If the Area code doesn't start with "660" or "816".
        IncorrectLengthException - If the length of the telephone number is less than 10 digits.
        NonDigitFoundException - If the values in the phone number are not digits.

      • calcLongTermPlan

        public double calcLongTermPlan(int noOfYears)
                        throws IncorrectYearsException
         Calculates the long term plan amount. 
 If the number of years the user pays as installment is equal to the insurance duration, then the method 
 should return the sum of the long term plan amount times the number of years 
 and 10% of the long term plan times the number of years.
 Else if the number of years  is less than the insurance duration, then the method should 
 return the calcShortTermPlan() method. Pass the number of years as the parameter
 to the calcShortTermPlan() method.
 If the number of years is greater than the insurance duration or less 
 than equal to zero, then the method should throw the IncorrectYearsException.
 
         For example: If number of years is 5, then the method 
 should return the value as 550000.00
        Specified by:
        calcLongTermPlan in interface PropertyInsurance
        Parameters:
        noOfYears - The number of years the user pays to the insurance company.
        Returns:
        Returns the value of long term plan calculation.
        Throws:
        IncorrectYearsException - If the number of years is greater than the insurance duration or less than equal to zero.

      • calcShortTermPlan

        public double calcShortTermPlan(int noOfYears)
                         throws IncorrectYearsException
         Calculates the short term plan amount. 
 If the number of years the user pays as installment is equal to 4, then the 
 method should return the difference of the long term plan amount times 
 the number of years and 10% of the long term plan amount times the number of years;
 else if the number of years is equal to 3, then the method should return the difference of
 the long term plan amount times the number of years and 15% of the long term plan amount times 
 the number of years;
 else if the number of years is equal to 2, then the method should return the difference of 
 the long term plan amount times the number of years and 20% of the long term plan amount times
 the number of years;
 else if the number of years is equal to 1, then the method should return the difference of 
 the long term plan amount times the number of years and 25% of the long term plan amount times
 the number of years.
 else if the number of years is equal to insurance duration, then the method should return the
 calcLongTermPlan() method. Pass the number of years as the parameter to the 
 calcLongTermPlan() method.
 If the number of years is greater than the insurance duration or less 
 than equal to zero, then the method should throw the IncorrectYearsException.
 
         For example: If number of years is 4, then the method should return the value as 
 360000.00
        Specified by:
        calcShortTermPlan in interface PropertyInsurance
        Parameters:
        noOfYears - The number of years the user pays to the insurance company.
        Returns:
        Returns the value of short term plan calculation.
        Throws:
        IncorrectYearsException - If the number of years is greater than the insurance duration or less than equal to zero.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
         All the private variable are separated by one space. Print the String values left 
 justified by 10 spaces and print the interger values right justified by 3 spaces. 
 Note: Print the telephone numbers in xxx-xxx-xxxx format.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of details of the owner.
